visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing color frequency distribution using synthetic data with linear trend and normal variation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 10 categorical observations (color spectrum) with one quantitative variable (frequency percentage). Synthetic data combines a linear trend (30% baseline + 5% increment per category) with normal variation (σ=5%) to simulate real-world measurement noise while maintaining domain validity for color spectrum analysis. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by removing redundant gridlines and legend while using Cairo's preattentive principles through categorical color matching. Column height variations (μ=53.1%, σ=14.2) leverage position and length perceptual channels for accurate magnitude comparisons. Direct color-label associations eliminate need for separate legend while maintaining accessibility through text-color redundancy.
